content.description: A very beautiful thin left leaning finger crack which then joins Nova Express for a few feet before traversing back right along the ledge to a bolt and follow the thin seam to another bolt. Now you can either go straight up and slightly left through the broken seams (5.11+/12-, more commonly done nowadays) or traverse right (original finish) and follow an easier top-out (5.11).
content.protection: This is a trad route so you need small pieces to 1 inch and a number 3 cam with a few slings and quickdraws for the two bolts at the top and the anchors.
content.location: This route is just to the right of Nova Express. It is the thin crack that looks impossible to protect but you can find solid pro.

content.description: This is the beautiful jamcrack in the center of the East Face.
Thin and delicate face climbing on good edges and a small seam.
content.protection: Small to medium sized cam/wires and 7 bolts.
content.location: Start on Welcome to My Nightmare. After about 20 feet, move straight up following the bolted line. Finish as for Nightmare.

content.description:
It climbs beautifully on bomber small edges, side pulls and thumberclings, as one might expect from a cryptic Donner summit granite face/slab climb. It's a shorter but much stouter sibling to the neighboring "Welcome to My Nightmare," "Nice Dreams," and "Death Tongue;" the name carries the theme forth. It reminded me of "Aromatic" at Pine Creek and "Holy Wars" at the ORG, only harder and thinner. The movement is ace; quality of rock is second to none! I left the proposed grade a bit vague and open-ended but I would welcome your opinions!

All hardware are stainless steel petzl

wedge bolts and hangers! Go get on it!

Update: as of 11/27/21, there is now an independent anchor directly over the line.
content.location: Between Brain Child and Left Dropout.

content.description: Little Feat is located on the blunt arete directly facing you as you first arrive at the east-facing routes on Snowshed wall.  There are five or six crux moves on the route punctuated by a couple of good rests.
Start up Farewell to Arms, then continue straight up the finger cracks instead of going left.
content.protection: Single rack to 2", doubles to .6".   2 bolt anchor to right
content.location: Same start as Farewell to Arms

content.description: This is the pumper crack on the left of the East Face. It leans slightly left.
content.protection: Pro to 3". Â Two bolts w/ Mussy hooks at anchors.

content.description:
Start on Drop Out Right. Follow the underclings to join Drop Out Left.

A good link-up that avoids the R section of the left line but climbs the nice upper crack.
content.protection: Single rack to #2 camalot and maybe an extra .5 and .75.
content.location: Start on a left-arching flake to the left of Nova Express.

content.description: Thin, left-arching crack to grovel-fest offwidth and chimney.  Surprisingly good.  Not in the Carville guidebook, referred to as "Drop Out 1" in the newer book.  Finally sprouted its own anchors about 5 years ago.
content.protection: Thin for the bottom, up to 5" for the upper part.
content.location: Between Nova Express and Drop Out Left.

content.description: Thin, technical, and slippery face start to hand crack. The old rating was a solid sandbag at .10d. Recommend stick-clipping the bolt, as a fall before clipping would be ugly - stick-clipping would also remove the "R" rating for the route. Referred to as "Drop Out" in the Carville guide and "Drop Out 2" in the newer guidebook.
content.location: First route to the right of the obvious chimney (Rage Reduction).

content.description:
The crimpfest to the climber's left of Farewell to Arms. Originally established at 5.12+, holds have broken to make it harder.

Follow the bolt line up in a sea of crimps (and a couple of pockets). Rest where you can because the climbing only gets harder. More obvious crimps will take you to the left of the bolt line near the top, with a heartbreaking crux at the last bolt as you dance into a seam that takes you to the anchor stance. Congratulations!

According to the guidebook, copping out to the arete before clipping the last bolt lowers the difficulty to 13a.
content.location: To the left of Farewell to Arms.
